game_instances.prompt:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the pillow on the counter, the book on the shelf and the plate on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

action_definitions.asp:
{ action_t(TURN,open,THING):at_t(TURN,THING,ROOM),closed_t(TURN,THING) } 1 :- turn(TURN), at_t(TURN,player1,ROOM), not turn_limit(TURN).
open_t(TURN+1,THING) :- action_t(TURN,open,THING).
open_t(TURN+1,THING) :- turn(TURN), open_t(TURN,THING), not action_t(TURN,close,THING).

parameters: {{ r }} is not a room. (This should not occur.)
{{ p }} is not a player. (This should not occur.)
precondition: You are not where you are! (This should not occur.)

action_definitions.asp:
{ action_t(TURN,close,THING):at_t(TURN,THING,ROOM),open_t(TURN,THING) } 1 :- turn(TURN), at_t(TURN,player1,ROOM), not turn_limit(TURN).
closed_t(TURN+1,THING) :- action_t(TURN,close,THING).
closed_t(TURN+1,THING) :- turn(TURN), closed_t(TURN,THING), not action_t(TURN,open,THING).
action_definitions.explanation: To VERB is to remove or block an opening of something, and make its contents unavailable for use or interaction.

action_definitions.lark:
take: TAKE PREP* thing (PREP thing)*
TAKE.1: ("take" | "grab" | "pick" | "get") WS
action_definitions.pddl:
(:action TAKE
    :parameters (?e - takeable ?s - receptacle ?p - player ?i - inventory ?r - room)
    :precondition (and
        (at ?p ?r)
        (at ?e ?r)
        (or 
            (in ?e inventory)
            (at ?s ?r)
            )        
        (accessible ?e)
        (or
            (and
                (on ?e ?s)
                (support ?s)
                )
            (and
                (open ?s)
                (container ?s)
                (in ?e ?s)
                )
            )
        )
    :effect (and
        (in ?e ?i)
        (when
            (and
                (support ?s)
                (on ?e ?s)
                )
            (not (on ?e ?s))
            )
        (when
            (and
                (container ?s)
                (in ?e ?s)
                )
            (not (in ?e ?s))
            )
    )
)

action_definitions.asp:
{ action_t(TURN,take,THING):at_t(TURN,THING,ROOM),takeable(THING),in_t(TURN,THING,CONTAINER),open_t(TURN,CONTAINER),at_t(TURN,player1,ROOM);action_t(TURN,take,THING):at_t(TURN,THING,ROOM),takeable(THING),on_t(TURN,THING,SUPPORT),support(SUPPORT),at_t(TURN,player1,ROOM) } 1 :- turn(TURN), at_t(TURN,player1,ROOM), not turn_limit(TURN).
in_t(TURN+1,THING,inventory) :- action_t(TURN,take,THING).
in_t(TURN+1,THING,TARGET) :- turn(TURN), in_t(TURN,THING,TARGET), not action_t(TURN,take,THING), TARGET != inventory.
on_t(TURN+1,THING,TARGET) :- turn(TURN), on_t(TURN,THING,TARGET), not action_t(TURN,take,THING).
action_definitions.explanation: To VERB is to get something into one's hands, possession or control.

action_definitions.lark:
put: PUT thing ("back" WS)* PREP* thing
PUT.1: ("put" | "leave" | "place" | "drop") WS
action_definitions.pddl:
(:action PUT
    :parameters (?e - movable ?t - receptacle ?p - player ?i - inventory ?r - room)
    :precondition (and
        (at ?p ?r)
        (at ?e ?r)
        (at ?t ?r)
        (or
            (and
                (container ?t)
                (open ?t)
                )
            (support ?t)
            )
        )
    :effect (and
        (not (in ?e ?i))
        (when
            (support ?t)
            (on ?e ?t)
            )
        (when
            (container ?t)
            (in ?e ?t)
            )
        )
)

at_t(TURN+1,THING,TARGET) :- action_t(TURN,go,TARGET), in_t(TURN,THING,inventory).

game_instances.prompt:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

In addition to common actions, you can perce. To perce is to make something physically unobstructed and uncovered, and make its contents available for use or interaction.

Your goal for this game is: Put the uner on the trion, the natin on the trion and the peach on the trion.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

open_t(TURN+1,THING) :- action_t(TURN,open,THING).

action_definitions.asp:
{ action_t(TURN,close,THING):at_t(TURN,THING,ROOM),open_t(TURN,THING) } 1 :- turn(TURN), at_t(TURN,player1,ROOM), not turn_limit(TURN).
closed_t(TURN+1,THING) :- action_t(TURN,close,THING).
closed_t(TURN+1,THING) :- turn(TURN), closed_t(TURN,THING), not action_t(TURN,open,THING).
action_definitions.explanation: To VERB is to remove or block an opening of something, and make its contents unavailable for use or interaction.

action_definitions.lark:
take: TAKE PREP* thing (PREP thing)*
TAKE.1: ("take" | "grab" | "pick" | "get") WS
action_definitions.pddl:
(:action TAKE
    :parameters (?e - takeable ?s - receptacle ?p - player ?i - inventory ?r - room)
    :precondition (and
        (at ?p ?r)
        (at ?e ?r)
        (or 
            (in ?e inventory)
            (at ?s ?r)
            )        
        (accessible ?e)
        (or
            (and
                (on ?e ?s)
                (support ?s)
                )
            (and
                (open ?s)
                (container ?s)
                (in ?e ?s)
                )
            )
        )
    :effect (and
        (in ?e ?i)
        (when
            (and
                (support ?s)
                (on ?e ?s)
                )
            (not (on ?e ?s))
            )
        (when
            (and
                (container ?s)
                (in ?e ?s)
                )
            (not (in ?e ?s))
            )
    )
)

action_definitions.asp:
{ action_t(TURN,take,THING):at_t(TURN,THING,ROOM),takeable(THING),in_t(TURN,THING,CONTAINER),open_t(TURN,CONTAINER),at_t(TURN,player1,ROOM);action_t(TURN,take,THING):at_t(TURN,THING,ROOM),takeable(THING),on_t(TURN,THING,SUPPORT),support(SUPPORT),at_t(TURN,player1,ROOM) } 1 :- turn(TURN), at_t(TURN,player1,ROOM), not turn_limit(TURN).
in_t(TURN+1,THING,inventory) :- action_t(TURN,take,THING).
in_t(TURN+1,THING,TARGET) :- turn(TURN), in_t(TURN,THING,TARGET), not action_t(TURN,take,THING), TARGET != inventory.
on_t(TURN+1,THING,TARGET) :- turn(TURN), on_t(TURN,THING,TARGET), not action_t(TURN,take,THING).
action_definitions.explanation: To VERB is to get something into one's hands, possession or control.

action_definitions.lark:
put: PUT thing ("back" WS)* PREP* thing
PUT.1: ("put" | "leave" | "place" | "drop") WS
action_definitions.pddl:
(:action PUT
    :parameters (?e - movable ?t - receptacle ?p - player ?i - inventory ?r - room)
    :precondition (and
        (at ?p ?r)
        (at ?e ?r)
        (at ?t ?r)
        (or
            (and
                (container ?t)
                (open ?t)
                )
            (support ?t)
            )
        )
    :effect (and
        (not (in ?e ?i))
        (when
            (support ?t)
            (on ?e ?t)
            )
        (when
            (container ?t)
            (in ?e ?t)
            )
        )
)

{ action_t(TURN,open,THING):at_t(TURN,THING,ROOM),closed_t(TURN,THING) } 1 :- turn(TURN), at_t(TURN,player1,ROOM), not turn_limit(TURN).
open_t(TURN+1,THING) :- action_t(TURN,open,THING).
open_t(TURN+1,THING) :- turn(TURN), open_t(TURN,THING), not action_t(TURN,close,THING).

action_definitions.asp:
{ action_t(TURN,close,THING):at_t(TURN,THING,ROOM),open_t(TURN,THING) } 1 :- turn(TURN), at_t(TURN,player1,ROOM), not turn_limit(TURN).
closed_t(TURN+1,THING) :- action_t(TURN,close,THING).
closed_t(TURN+1,THING) :- turn(TURN), closed_t(TURN,THING), not action_t(TURN,open,THING).

action_definitions.lark:
take: TAKE PREP* thing (PREP thing)*
TAKE.1: "aling" WS
action_definitions.pddl:
(:action TAKE
    :parameters (?e - takeable ?s - receptacle ?p - player ?i - inventory ?r - room)
    :precondition (and
        (at ?p ?r)
        (at ?e ?r)
        (or 
            (in ?e inventory)
            (at ?s ?r)
            )        
        (accessible ?e)
        (or
            (and
                (on ?e ?s)
                (support ?s)
                )
            (and
                (open ?s)
                (container ?s)
                (in ?e ?s)
                )
            )
        )
    :effect (and
        (in ?e ?i)
        (when
            (and
                (support ?s)
                (on ?e ?s)
                )
            (not (on ?e ?s))
            )
        (when
            (and
                (container ?s)
                (in ?e ?s)
                )
            (not (in ?e ?s))
            )
    )
)

in_t(TURN+1,THING,inventory) :- action_t(TURN,take,THING).
in_t(TURN+1,THING,TARGET) :- turn(TURN), in_t(TURN,THING,TARGET), not action_t(TURN,take,THING), TARGET != inventory.

action_definitions.lark:
put: PUT thing ("back" WS)* PREP* thing
PUT.1: ("put" | "leave" | "place" | "drop") WS
action_definitions.pddl:
(:action PUT
    :parameters (?e - movable ?t - receptacle ?p - player ?i - inventory ?r - room)
    :precondition (and
        (at ?p ?r)
        (at ?e ?r)
        (at ?t ?r)
        (or
            (and
                (container ?t)
                (open ?t)
                )
            (support ?t)
            )
        )
    :effect (and
        (not (in ?e ?i))
        (when
            (support ?t)
            (on ?e ?t)
            )
        (when
            (container ?t)
            (in ?e ?t)
            )
        )
)

            )
    )
)

action_definitions.lark:
take: TAKE PREP* thing (PREP thing)*
TAKE.1: ("take" | "grab" | "pick" | "get") WS
action_definitions.pddl:
(:action TAKE
    :parameters (?e - takeable ?s - receptacle ?p - player ?i - inventory ?r - room)
    :precondition (and
        (at ?p ?r)
        (at ?e ?r)
        (or 
            (in ?e inventory)
            (at ?s ?r)
            )        
        (accessible ?e)
        (or
            (and
                (on ?e ?s)
                (support ?s)
                )
            (and
                (open ?s)
                (container ?s)
                (in ?e ?s)
                )
            )
        )
    :effect (and
        (in ?e ?i)
        (when
            (and
                (support ?s)
                (on ?e ?s)
                )
            (not (on ?e ?s))
            )
        (when
            (and
                (container ?s)
                (in ?e ?s)
                )
            (not (in ?e ?s))
            )
    )
)

action_definitions.lark:
put: PUT thing ("back" WS)* PREP* thing
PUT.1: "pyell" WS
action_definitions.pddl:
(:action PUT
    :parameters (?e - movable ?t - receptacle ?p - player ?i - inventory ?r - room)
    :precondition (and
        (at ?p ?r)
        (at ?e ?r)
        (at ?t ?r)
        (or
            (and
                (container ?t)
                (open ?t)
                )
            (support ?t)
            )
        )
    :effect (and
        (not (in ?e ?i))
        (when
            (support ?t)
            (on ?e ?t)
            )
        (when
            (container ?t)
            (in ?e ?t)
            )
        )
)

game_instances.prompt:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is to brew a potion following the potion recipe.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.
initial_state:
text(potionrecipe1,Corvidae potion
Ingredients: Water, banana, peach, eye of newt.
1. Pour water into your cauldron.
2. Mix the liquid using a borpulus.
3. Add the eye of newt into your cauldron.
4. Swirl a zulpowand over your cauldron.
5. Put the banana into your cauldron.
6. Put the peach into your cauldron.
)
optimal_commands: put eye of newt in cauldron

event_definitions.pddl:
(:event ANTIGRAVITY_OBJECTS
    :parameters (?e - entity ?h - receptacle ?c - ceiling ?r - room ?p - player)
    :precondition (and
        (room ?r workshop)
        (at ?e ?r)
        (at ?p ?r)
        (not (type ?h ceiling))
        (or
            (on ?e ?h)
            (and
                (in ?e ?h)
                (open ?h)
                )
            )
        (type ?c ceiling)
        )
    :effect (and
        (when
            (and
                (in ?e ?h)
                (open ?h)
                )
            (and
                (not (in ?e ?h))
                (on ?e ?c)
                )
            )
        (when
            (on ?e ?h)
            (and
                (not (on ?e ?h))
                (on ?e ?c)
                )
            )
        )
    )
event_definitions.event_feedback: The {{ e }} floats up to the ceiling.

event_definitions.pddl:
(:event ANTIGRAVPLAYERSTART
    :parameters (?r - room ?p - player)
    :precondition (and
        (room ?r workshop)
        (at ?p ?r)
        (not (floating ?p))
        )
    :effect (and
        (floating ?p)
        )
    )
event_definitions.event_feedback: Magical experiments have reversed and dampened gravity in this room. You begin to float in the air.

event_definitions.pddl:
(:event ANTIGRAVPLAYERSTOP
    :parameters (?r - room ?p - player)
    :precondition (and
        (not (room ?r workshop))
        (at ?p ?r)
        (floating ?p)
        )
    :effect (and
        (not (floating ?p))
        )
    )
event_definitions.event_feedback: Gravity behaves normally in this room. You stop floating in the air.
The world twists around you, and you suddenly find yourself elsewhere. {{ room_desc }}

event_definitions.pddl:
(:event POTIONSTEP1
	:parameters (?l - liquid ?c - container ?r - room)
	:precondition (and
		(at ?l ?r)
		(at ?c ?r)
		(in ?l ?c)
		(type ?c cauldron)
		(type ?l water)
		(borpulusstirred ?l)
		)
	:effect (and
		(not (at ?l ?r))
		(not (in ?l ?c))
		(not (accessible ?l))
		(not (borpulusstirred ?l))
		(type liquid1 liquid)
		(at liquid1 ?r)
		(in liquid1 ?c)
		(accessible liquid1)
		)
	)
event_definitions.event_feedback: The water undulates with a phase shift creating a liquid.
event_definitions.asp:
event_t(TURN,potion_step_1,ROOM) :- turn(TURN), room(ROOM,_), at_t(TURN,water1,ROOM), at_t(TURN,cauldron1,ROOM),in_t(TURN,water1,cauldron1), borpulusstirred_t(TURN,water1).
type(liquid1,liquid) :- event_t(TURN,potion_step_1,ROOM).
at_t(TURN,liquid1,ROOM) :- event_t(TURN,potion_step_1,ROOM).
in_t(TURN,liquid1,cauldron1) :- event_t(TURN,potion_step_1,ROOM).
accessible_t(TURN,liquid1) :- event_t(TURN,potion_step_1,ROOM).
at_t(TURN+1,liquid1,ROOM) :- at_t(TURN,liquid1,ROOM), not event_t(TURN,potion_step_2,ROOM), turn(TURN), room(ROOM,_).
in_t(TURN+1,liquid1,cauldron1) :- in_t(TURN,liquid1,cauldron1), not event_t(TURN,potion_step_2,ROOM), turn(TURN), room(ROOM,_).
accessible_t(TURN+1,liquid1) :- accessible_t(TURN,liquid1), not event_t(TURN,potion_step_2,ROOM), turn(TURN), room(ROOM,_).
at_t(TURN+1,water1,ROOM) :- turn(TURN), at_t(TURN,water1,ROOM), not event_t(TURN,potion_step_1,ROOM), room(ROOM,_).
in_t(TURN+1,water1,cauldron1) :- turn(TURN), in_t(TURN,water1,cauldron1), not event_t(TURN,potion_step_1,ROOM), room(ROOM,_).
accessible_t(TURN+1,water1) :- turn(TURN), accessible_t(TURN,water1), not event_t(TURN,potion_step_1,ROOM), room(ROOM,_).
borpulusstirred_t(TURN+1,water1) :- turn(TURN), borpulusstirred_t(TURN,water1), not event_t(TURN,potion_step_1,ROOM), room(ROOM,_).

event_definitions.pddl:
(:event POTIONSTEP2
	:parameters (?l - liquid ?i - ingredient ?c - container ?r - room)
	:precondition (and
		(at liquid1 ?r)
		(at ?c ?r)
		(at ?i ?r)
		(type ?c cauldron)
		(type ?i eyeofnewt)
		(in ?i ?c)
		(in liquid1 ?c)
		)
	:effect (and
		(not (type liquid1 liquid))
		(not (at liquid1 ?r))
		(not (in liquid1 ?c))
		(not (accessible liquid1))
		(not (at ?i ?r))
		(not (in ?i ?c))
		(not (type ?i eyeofnewt))
		(type liquid2 liquid)
		(at liquid2  ?r)
		(in liquid2  ?c)
		(accessible liquid2 )
		)
	)
event_definitions.event_feedback: The eye of newt combines with the liquid in the cauldron with a gloopy sound.
event_definitions.asp:
event_t(TURN,potion_step_2,ROOM) :- turn(TURN), room(ROOM,_), at_t(TURN,eyeofnewt1,ROOM), at_t(TURN,cauldron1,ROOM),in_t(TURN,liquid1,cauldron1), in_t(TURN,eyeofnewt1,cauldron1).
type(liquid2,liquid) :- event_t(TURN,potion_step_2,ROOM).
at_t(TURN,liquid2,ROOM) :- event_t(TURN,potion_step_2,ROOM).
in_t(TURN,liquid2,cauldron1) :- event_t(TURN,potion_step_2,ROOM).
accessible_t(TURN,liquid2) :- event_t(TURN,potion_step_2,ROOM).
at_t(TURN+1,liquid2,ROOM) :- at_t(TURN,liquid2,ROOM), not event_t(TURN,potion_step_3,ROOM), turn(TURN), room(ROOM,_).
in_t(TURN+1,liquid2,cauldron1) :- in_t(TURN,liquid2,cauldron1), not event_t(TURN,potion_step_3,ROOM), turn(TURN), room(ROOM,_).
accessible_t(TURN+1,liquid2) :- accessible_t(TURN,liquid2), not event_t(TURN,potion_step_3,ROOM), turn(TURN), room(ROOM,_).
at_t(TURN+1,liquid1,ROOM) :- turn(TURN), at_t(TURN,liquid1,ROOM), not event_t(TURN,potion_step_2,ROOM), room(ROOM,_).
in_t(TURN+1,liquid1,cauldron1) :- turn(TURN), in_t(TURN,liquid1,cauldron1), not event_t(TURN,potion_step_2,ROOM), room(ROOM,_).
accessible_t(TURN+1,liquid1) :- turn(TURN), accessible_t(TURN,liquid1), not event_t(TURN,potion_step_2,ROOM), room(ROOM,_).
at_t(TURN+1,eyeofnewt1,ROOM) :- turn(TURN), at_t(TURN,eyeofnewt1,ROOM), not event_t(TURN,potion_step_2,ROOM), room(ROOM,_).
in_t(TURN+1,eyeofnewt1,cauldron1) :- turn(TURN), in_t(TURN,eyeofnewt1,cauldron1), not event_t(TURN,potion_step_2,ROOM), room(ROOM,_).

event_definitions.pddl:
(:event POTIONSTEP3
	:parameters (?l - liquid ?c - container ?r - room)
	:precondition (and
		(at liquid2 ?r)
		(at ?c ?r)
		(in liquid2 ?c)
		(type ?c cauldron)
		(type liquid2 liquid)
		(zulponated ?c)
		)
	:effect (and
		(not (at liquid2 ?r))
		(not (in liquid2 ?c))
		(not (accessible liquid2))
		(type liquid3 liquid)
		(at liquid3 ?r)
		(in liquid3 ?c)
		(accessible liquid3)
		)
	)
event_definitions.event_feedback: The liquid in the zulponated cauldron churgulates with a puff of vapor.

	:precondition (and

game_instances.prompt:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is to brew a potion following the potion recipe.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.
initial_state:
text(potionrecipe1,Espeldertatarum potion
Ingredients: Water, red beetle, spiderweb, sandwich.
1. Pour water into your cauldron.
2. Add the red beetle into your cauldron.
3. Wiggle a fairy wand on your cauldron.
4. Wiggle a ice wand over your cauldron.
5. Put the spiderweb into your cauldron.
6. Put the sandwich into your cauldron.
)

event_definitions.pddl:
(:event ANTIGRAVITY_OBJECTS
    :parameters (?e - entity ?h - receptacle ?c - ceiling ?r - room ?p - player)
    :precondition (and
        (room ?r workshop)
        (at ?e ?r)
        (at ?p ?r)
        (not (type ?h ceiling))
        (or
            (on ?e ?h)
            (and
                (in ?e ?h)
                (open ?h)
                )
            )
        (type ?c ceiling)
        )
    :effect (and
        (when
            (and
                (in ?e ?h)
                (open ?h)
                )
            (and
                (not (in ?e ?h))
                (on ?e ?c)
                )
            )
        (when
            (on ?e ?h)
            (and
                (not (on ?e ?h))
                (on ?e ?c)
                )
            )
        )
    )
event_definitions.event_feedback: The {{ e }} floats up to the ceiling.

event_definitions.pddl:
(:event ANTIGRAVPLAYERSTART
    :parameters (?r - room ?p - player)
    :precondition (and
        (room ?r workshop)
        (at ?p ?r)
        (not (floating ?p))
        )
    :effect (and
        (floating ?p)
        )
    )
event_definitions.event_feedback: Magical experiments have reversed and dampened gravity in this room. You begin to float in the air.

event_definitions.pddl:
(:event ANTIGRAVPLAYERSTOP
    :parameters (?r - room ?p - player)
    :precondition (and
        (not (room ?r workshop))
        (at ?p ?r)
        (floating ?p)
        )
    :effect (and
        (not (floating ?p))
        )
    )
event_definitions.event_feedback: Gravity behaves normally in this room. You stop floating in the air.
The world twists around you, and you suddenly find yourself elsewhere. {{ room_desc }}

game_instances.prompt:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is to brew a potion following the potion recipe.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.
initial_state:
text(potionrecipe1,Very tasty potion
Ingredients: Ectoplasm, plonkle crystal, peach, plunkle crystal.
1. Pour ectoplasm into your cauldron.
2. Mix the liquid using a borpulus.
3. Add the plonkle crystal into your cauldron.
4. Put the peach into your cauldron.
5. Swirl a fire wand at your cauldron.
6. Put the plunkle crystal into your cauldron.
)

event_definitions.pddl:
(:event ANTIGRAVITY_OBJECTS
    :parameters (?e - entity ?h - receptacle ?c - ceiling ?r - room ?p - player)
    :precondition (and
        (room ?r workshop)
        (at ?e ?r)
        (at ?p ?r)
        (not (type ?h ceiling))
        (or
            (on ?e ?h)
            (and
                (in ?e ?h)
                (open ?h)
                )
            )
        (type ?c ceiling)
        )
    :effect (and
        (when
            (and
                (in ?e ?h)
                (open ?h)
                )
            (and
                (not (in ?e ?h))
                (on ?e ?c)
                )
            )
        (when
            (on ?e ?h)
            (and
                (not (on ?e ?h))
                (on ?e ?c)
                )
            )
        )
    )
event_definitions.event_feedback: The {{ e }} floats up to the ceiling.

event_definitions.pddl:
(:event ANTIGRAVPLAYERSTART
    :parameters (?r - room ?p - player)
    :precondition (and
        (room ?r workshop)
        (at ?p ?r)
        (not (floating ?p))
        )
    :effect (and
        (floating ?p)
        )
    )
event_definitions.event_feedback: Magical experiments have reversed and dampened gravity in this room. You begin to float in the air.

event_definitions.pddl:
(:event ANTIGRAVPLAYERSTOP
    :parameters (?r - room ?p - player)
    :precondition (and
        (not (room ?r workshop))
        (at ?p ?r)
        (floating ?p)
        )
    :effect (and
        (not (floating ?p))
        )
    )
event_definitions.event_feedback: Gravity behaves normally in this room. You stop floating in the air.
The world twists around you, and you suddenly find yourself elsewhere. {{ room_desc }}

game_instances.prompt:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is to brew a potion following the potion recipe.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.
initial_state:
text(potionrecipe1,Rincewind's potion
Ingredients: Ectoplasm, apple, peach, spider egg.
1. Pour ectoplasm into your cauldron.
2. Stir the liquid using a borpulus.
3. Add the apple into your cauldron.
4. Wave a ice wand on your cauldron.
5. Put the spider egg into your cauldron.
6. Put the peach into your cauldron.
)

event_definitions.pddl:
(:event ANTIGRAVITY_OBJECTS
    :parameters (?e - entity ?h - receptacle ?c - ceiling ?r - room ?p - player)
    :precondition (and
        (room ?r workshop)
        (at ?e ?r)
        (at ?p ?r)
        (not (type ?h ceiling))
        (or
            (on ?e ?h)
            (and
                (in ?e ?h)
                (open ?h)
                )
            )
        (type ?c ceiling)
        )
    :effect (and
        (when
            (and
                (in ?e ?h)
                (open ?h)
                )
            (and
                (not (in ?e ?h))
                (on ?e ?c)
                )
            )
        (when
            (on ?e ?h)
            (and
                (not (on ?e ?h))
                (on ?e ?c)
                )
            )
        )
    )
event_definitions.event_feedback: The {{ e }} floats up to the ceiling.

event_definitions.pddl:
(:event ANTIGRAVPLAYERSTART
    :parameters (?r - room ?p - player)
    :precondition (and
        (room ?r workshop)
        (at ?p ?r)
        (not (floating ?p))
        )
    :effect (and
        (floating ?p)
        )
    )
event_definitions.event_feedback: Magical experiments have reversed and dampened gravity in this room. You begin to float in the air.

event_definitions.pddl:
(:event ANTIGRAVPLAYERSTOP
    :parameters (?r - room ?p - player)
    :precondition (and
        (not (room ?r workshop))
        (at ?p ?r)
        (floating ?p)
        )
    :effect (and
        (not (floating ?p))
        )
    )
event_definitions.event_feedback: Gravity behaves normally in this room. You stop floating in the air.
The world twists around you, and you suddenly find yourself elsewhere. {{ room_desc }}

game_instances.prompt:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is to brew a potion following the potion recipe.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.
initial_state:
text(potionrecipe1,Floorboard potion
Ingredients: Ectoplasm, eye of newt, peach, spider egg.
1. Pour ectoplasm into your cauldron.
2. Add the peach into your cauldron.
3. Wiggle a zulpowand over your cauldron.
4. Use a fairy wand over your cauldron.
5. Add the eye of newt into your cauldron.
6. Put the spider egg into your cauldron.
)
optimal_commands: put eye of newt in cauldron

game_instances.prompt:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is to brew a potion following the potion recipe.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.
initial_state:
text(potionrecipe1,That odd potion
Ingredients: Ectoplasm, spider, banana, green beetle.
1. Pour ectoplasm into your cauldron.
2. Put the spider into your cauldron.
3. Put the banana into your cauldron.
4. Use a fairy wand on your cauldron.
5. Wiggle a ice wand at your cauldron.
6. Add the green beetle into your cauldron.
)

event_definitions.pddl:
(:event ANTIGRAVITY_OBJECTS
    :parameters (?e - entity ?h - receptacle ?c - ceiling ?r - room ?p - player)
    :precondition (and
        (room ?r workshop)
        (at ?e ?r)
        (at ?p ?r)
        (not (type ?h ceiling))
        (or
            (on ?e ?h)
            (and
                (in ?e ?h)
                (open ?h)
                )
            )
        (type ?c ceiling)
        )
    :effect (and
        (when
            (and
                (in ?e ?h)
                (open ?h)
                )
            (and
                (not (in ?e ?h))
                (on ?e ?c)
                )
            )
        (when
            (on ?e ?h)
            (and
                (not (on ?e ?h))
                (on ?e ?c)
                )
            )
        )
    )
event_definitions.event_feedback: The {{ e }} floats up to the ceiling.

event_definitions.pddl:
(:event ANTIGRAVPLAYERSTART
    :parameters (?r - room ?p - player)
    :precondition (and
        (room ?r workshop)
        (at ?p ?r)
        (not (floating ?p))
        )
    :effect (and
        (floating ?p)
        )
    )
event_definitions.event_feedback: Magical experiments have reversed and dampened gravity in this room. You begin to float in the air.

event_definitions.pddl:
(:event ANTIGRAVPLAYERSTOP
    :parameters (?r - room ?p - player)
    :precondition (and
        (not (room ?r workshop))
        (at ?p ?r)
        (floating ?p)
        )
    :effect (and
        (not (floating ?p))
        )
    )
event_definitions.event_feedback: Gravity behaves normally in this room. You stop floating in the air.
The world twists around you, and you suddenly find yourself elsewhere. {{ room_desc }}
